title: Teaching LLMs to Ask: Self-Querying Category-Theoretic Planning for Under-Specified Reasoning
raw_snippet: arXiv:2601.20014v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Inference-time planning with large language models frequently breaks under partial observability: when task-critical preconditions are not specified at query time, models tend to hallucinate missing facts or produce plans that violate hard constraints. title: Fuzzy Categorical Planning: Autonomous Goal Satisfaction with Graded Semantic Constraints
raw_snippet: arXiv:2601.20021v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Natural-language planning often involves vague predicates (e.g., suitable substitute, stable enough) whose satisfaction is inherently graded. title: Should I Have Expressed a Different Intent? Counterfactual Generation for LLM-Based Autonomous Control
raw_snippet: arXiv:2601.20090v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large language model (LLM)-powered agents can translate high-level user intents into plans and actions in an environment. title: Endogenous Reprompting: Self-Evolving Cognitive Alignment for Unified Multimodal Models
